meta.name: Generate & Schedule Social Media Posts with GPT-4 and Telegram Approval Workflow

name: Universal Social Media Content Generator with AI

nodes.name: Schedule Trigger

interval.description: Triggers the workflow every 5 days at 9 AM. You can adjust the frequency and time based on your content posting schedule.

nodes.description: This node triggers your content generation workflow on a schedule. Default is every 5 days at 9 AM, but you can adjust this to daily, weekly, or any custom schedule that fits your content strategy. The workflow will start automatically at the specified time.

nodes.name: Create Schedule Timestamp
nodes.description: Creates a human-readable timestamp and schedule name for tracking purposes. This helps you identify which schedule triggered the content generation, especially useful if you have multiple schedules running.

nodes.name: Request Content Topic via Telegram

parameters.text:
üöÄ **Content Generation Time!**

It's time for your {{ $json.scheduleName }} content creation session.

Please reply with:
- Your topic or theme
- Type 'single' for one post or 'thread' for multiple connected posts

Example responses:
- 'sustainable living tips - single'
- 'how to start a podcast - thread'
- 'morning motivation - single'

nodes.description: Sends a message to your Telegram chat asking for the content topic and format. The message will appear in the Telegram chat/channel you've configured in the credentials. Make sure to set up your Telegram bot and add the chat ID in the credentials.

nodes.name: Wait for User Topic Reply
nodes.description: This webhook listens for your reply in Telegram. When you send a message in response to the topic request, this node captures it and passes it to the next step. Make sure the webhook is properly configured in your Telegram bot settings.

nodes.name: Validate Reply Format
nodes.description: Checks if the Telegram message is a valid reply to the bot's request. It ensures the message is not empty and is actually a reply to the bot's prompt. This prevents the workflow from processing random messages in the chat.

nodes.name: Parse User Input
nodes.description: Extracts the topic and format from the user's message. Supports three formats: 'single' (one post), 'thread' (multiple connected posts), or 'auto' (let AI decide). The topic must be at least 3 characters long. If format is not specified, defaults to 'auto'.

nodes.name: Input Validation Check
nodes.description: Routes the workflow based on validation results. If the input passes validation, it proceeds to content generation. If validation fails, it sends an error message back to the user with instructions on the correct format.

nodes.name: Send Input Error Message

parameters.text:
‚ùå **Input Error**

{{ $json.error }}

Please try again with the correct format:
'your topic - single' or 'your topic - thread'

Examples:
- 'productivity tips - single'
- 'beginner's guide to investing - thread'
- 'motivational quote' (defaults to auto)

nodes.description: Sends an error message to the user if their input format is incorrect. Provides clear examples of the expected format to help users correct their input.

nodes.name: AI Content Generator

parameters.text:
=Create social media content about: {{ $json.topic }}
Format type: {{ $json.format_type }}

options.systemMessage:
=You are a professional social media content creator. Your task is to generate engaging, high-quality content for Twitter/X and LinkedIn.

CONTENT REQUIREMENTS:

CHARACTER COUNT:
- EVERY tweet/post MUST be between 240-265 characters
- Count characters before finalizing
- Rewrite if outside this range

FORMAT GUIDELINES:
- For 'single': Create one standalone post
- For 'thread': Create 3-6 connected posts that tell a complete story
- For 'auto': Decide based on topic complexity (simple topics = single, complex = thread)

WRITING STYLE:
- Clear, conversational tone
- Use simple language
- Include 1-2 relevant hashtags
- Be engaging and value-driven
- Professional but approachable
- NO numbered lists in the beginning of posts (avoid "1/", "2/" etc.)

CONTENT STRUCTURE:
- Hook: Start with an attention-grabbing statement
- Value: Provide useful information or insights
- Call-to-action: Encourage engagement (questions, thoughts, actions)

ADAPT TO TOPIC:
- Business topics: Professional, data-driven
- Creative topics: Inspiring, imaginative
- Educational topics: Clear, structured
- Personal topics: Authentic, relatable
- Technical topics: Simple explanations, practical examples

REMEMBER:
- Quality over quantity
- Each post should provide value
- Maintain consistency in tone throughout threads
- Use line breaks for readability
- End threads with a summary or key takeaway

nodes.description: The AI agent that generates your social media content. It uses the topic and format you provided to create posts optimized for engagement. The system prompt ensures consistent quality and character count. Configure retry attempts (default: 3) for reliability.

nodes.name: Structure AI Output
nodes.description: Defines the expected JSON structure for the AI's output. This ensures the AI returns content in a consistent format that can be processed by subsequent nodes. The schema includes fields for both single posts and threads.

nodes.name: Validate Generated Content
nodes.description: Performs quality checks on AI-generated content: character count validation (240-265 chars), format checking, and structure validation. Allows up to 30% error rate for flexibility. Logs detailed validation results for debugging.

nodes.name: Content Quality Gate
nodes.description: Final quality check before sending content for approval. Routes to preview creation if validation passed, or to error handling if content doesn't meet quality standards.

nodes.name: Send Generation Error

parameters.text:
‚ùå **Content Generation Failed**

{{ $json.error }}

The AI couldn't generate content that meets quality requirements. This usually happens with very complex or unclear topics.

Tips:
- Try simplifying your topic
- Be more specific about what you want
- Try a different format (single vs thread)

Please try again with a different topic or approach.

nodes.description: Notifies the user if content generation fails. Provides helpful tips on how to improve their topic or format choice for better results.

nodes.name: Format Content Preview
nodes.description: Creates a readable preview of all generated content for user review. Shows the topic, format, character count for each post, and the full content. This allows users to review before posting.

nodes.name: Send Preview & Await Approval
nodes.description: Sends the content preview to Telegram and waits for user approval. Users can click ‚úÖ to approve and post the content, or ‚ùå to cancel. The workflow pauses here until a response is received.

nodes.name: Check User Approval
nodes.description: Routes the workflow based on user's approval decision. If approved (‚úÖ), proceeds to post the content. If rejected (‚ùå), sends a cancellation message.

nodes.name: Send Cancellation Notice

parameters.text:
‚ùå **Content Cancelled**

The content has been cancelled as requested.

You can start over by sending a new topic anytime.

nodes.description: Confirms to the user that their content has been cancelled and won't be posted. Encourages them to try again with a new topic.

nodes.name: Split Posts for Publishing
nodes.description: Separates the array of posts into individual items for sequential posting. This is essential for threads, as each post needs to be published separately and linked together.

nodes.name: Web Research Tool (Optional)
nodes.description: Optional research tool that the AI can use to gather current information about the topic. Useful for trending topics, news, or fact-checking. Requires Tavily API credentials.

nodes.name: AI Language Model
nodes.description: The AI model used for content generation. Default is GPT-4 via OpenRouter. You can change this to other models like Claude, Gemini, or any model supported by OpenRouter. Model choice affects content quality and style.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Universal Social Media Content Generator

## Overview
This workflow automates social media content creation using AI. It generates high-quality posts for Twitter/X and LinkedIn based on any topic you provide.

## Features
- **Scheduled or Manual Triggers**: Run automatically on schedule or start manually
- **AI-Powered Generation**: Uses advanced language models to create engaging content
- **Quality Validation**: Ensures posts meet character limits and quality standards
- **Approval Workflow**: Review content before posting
- **Multi-Platform Support**: Posts to both Twitter/X and LinkedIn
- **Thread Support**: Create single posts or connected threads

## Setup Requirements
1. **Telegram Bot**: For receiving topics and approvals
   - Create a bot via @BotFather
   - Get your chat ID
   - Add credentials to n8n

2. **OpenRouter API**: For AI content generation
   - Sign up at openrouter.ai
   - Add API key to credentials

3. **Upload Post API**: For publishing to social platforms
   - Configure your social media accounts
   - Add credentials to n8n

4. **Tavily API (Optional)**: For web research
   - Only needed if you want AI to research topics
   - Sign up at tavily.com

## Usage
1. Workflow triggers on schedule or manually
2. You receive a Telegram message asking for topic
3. Reply with format: "your topic - single" or "your topic - thread"
4. AI generates content (240-265 chars per post)
5. Review the preview in Telegram
6. Approve (‚úÖ) or Cancel (‚ùå)
7. Content posts to your configured platforms

## Customization
- **Topics**: Works with any topic or niche
- **Tone**: Adjust the AI system prompt for your brand voice
- **Schedule**: Change trigger frequency as needed
- **Platforms**: Modify which platforms to post to
- **Validation**: Adjust character limits or quality thresholds

## Tips
- Be specific with topics for better results
- Use 'thread' format for complex topics
- Review and edit the AI system prompt for your needs
- Test with different AI models for varied styles

nodes.description: Complete documentation for setting up and using this workflow. Read this first to understand all features and requirements.

nodes.name: Merge Approval Data
nodes.description: Combines the content data with the approval response to pass all necessary information to the next steps.

nodes.name: Send Success Notification
nodes.description: Sends a final confirmation message showing which platforms successfully received the content. Helps you track posting status and troubleshoot any platform-specific issues.

nodes.name: Publish to Social Platforms
nodes.description: Posts the content to Twitter/X and LinkedIn. Configure which platforms to use in the parameters. For threads, posts are published sequentially with proper reply chains on Twitter/X.
